project1.title: Simple Pinterest
project1.description: A simple mock up of the look and functionality of Pinterest. A project that introduced us to using Promises
project1.technologiesUsed: HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Jquery, JSON, Promises, Bootstrap

project2.title: Shotz
project2.description: How to find the best locations for your movie shots! Used promises and JSON.
project2.technologiesUsed: HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Jquery, JSON, Modules, Promises

project3.title: What You See Is What You Get
project3.description: The story of Tomoe Gozen! DOM manipulation using Javascript, event listeners, and JSON files
project3.technologiesUsed: HTML, CSS, JavaScript, JSON, Modules, Bootstrap

project4.title: Thrones
project4.description: A Game of Thrones site where you can sort characters based on their house. Project utilized to give us more experience with JS event listeners
project4.technologiesUsed: HTML, CSS, JavaScript, JSON, Modules, Bootstrap

project5.title: Adoption Website
project5.description: An adoption website where you are able to sort based on pet type (cat, dino, dog, or all). Very similar to the Thrones project in that it gave us more experience with event listeners.
project5.technologiesUsed: HTML, CSS, Vanilla JavaScript, Version Control with Github, Bootstrap

project6.title: Sorting Hat
project6.description: A project that brings Hogwarts' Sorting Hat to life! Users are able to sort students into Houses and expel them. Worked with event listeners (particularly click events).
project6.technologiesUsed: HTML, CSS, Vanilla JavaScript, Version Control with Github

project7.title: Language Translator
project7.description: An app that uses a limited dictionary and then translates a holiday card message from English into another language.
project7.technologiesUsed: HTML, CSS, Vanilla JavaScript, Version Control with Github
